net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource

Class ResourceManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.ResourceManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceManager, DisposableBean, InitializingBean

    public class ResourceManagerImpl
extends Object
implements InitializingBean, DisposableBean, ResourceManager

    Manages resources for purposes of caching and sharing.

    Resource objects are registered and unregistered in this class. You must be sure to unregister resources when no longer valid to prevent memory leaks.

    Resources may be registered individually or using a name. Named resources are used to shared resources across components. If a resource with the given name is already registered, the existing ID is returned.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • getMaxResourceCount

        public int getMaxResourceCount()
        Get the maximum resource count. If the number of resources exceeds this value then unregistered resources will be removed. An example is factory resources which are not registered. In this case nothing will break as the resource will be created from the factory on demand.
        Returns:
        int.

      • getMemoryCacheSize

        public long getMemoryCacheSize()

        Returns:
        The size in bytes.

      • getResourceFromFactory

        public FactoryBasedResource getResourceFromFactory(String factoryId,
                                          String persistentResourceId)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Get a factory resource. The returned resource may not be the same object returned from the associated factory. It may be cached. Do not register the resource using one of the register methods. This method implicitly registers the resource in an appropriate way for factory resources.
        Specified by:
        getResourceFromFactory in interface ResourceManager
        Parameters:
        factoryId - the factory ID as returned by ResourceFactory.getFactoryId().
        persistentResourceId - the persistent resource ID, defined by the factory instance.
        Returns:
        Resource or null if the resource cannot be created.

        public void register(ResourceFactory factory)
        Register a factory.
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory to register.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a factory has already been registered with the same factory ID as the argument.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the factory ID is null or empty.

      • setCacheDirectory

        public void setCacheDirectory(File file)
        Set the cache directory. If not set disk caching will not be performed. There is no default for the cache directory.
        Parameters:
        file - The cache directory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file is null or does not exist / cannot be created or cannot be read from or written to.

      • setFilesystemBlockSize

        public void setFilesystemBlockSize(long filesystemBlockSize)
        Set the filesystem block size. This is used to compute disk cache overhead.
        Parameters:
        filesystemBlockSize - the filesystem block size.

      • setIsolationLevel

        public static void setIsolationLevel(net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.Resource resource,
                     Resource.IsolationLevel level)
        Set the isolation level for a resource. This method handles nesting and ensures the resource is not called with nested Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED calls. This method should be called using a try-finally construct to ensure Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_UNCOMMITTED is set or there may be a memory leak.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource.
        level - the level.

      • setMaxDiskBytes

        public void setMaxDiskBytes(long l)
        Set the maximum amount of data that can be stored in the disk cache.
        Parameters:
        l - The maximum size in bytes, may be zero or less to disable the disk cache.

      • setMaxDiskBytesPerStream

        public void setMaxDiskBytesPerStream(long l)
        Set the size of the maximum single data stream that may be present in the disk cache.
        Parameters:
        l - The maximum straem size in bytes, may be zero or less to disable the disk cache.

        public void setMaxResourceCount(int maxResourceCount)

        Parameters:
        maxResourceCount - the maximum resource count.
